definition: branch or subdivision of a family
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: The Tai groups of Thailand evolved into diverse sub-ethnicities in the process of formation and development.
sentences.chinese: 泰国的泰语民族在形成发展过程中，形成许多支系。

sentences.english: The Hakkas in one of branches of Han nationality.
Lineage B is restricted to part of northeast China.
sentences.chinese: 东北支系B仅局限分布在东北地区的东部。

sentences.english: This is one of the branches of the Roosevelt family.
sentences.chinese: 这是罗斯福家族的一个支系。

sentences.english: That slim lineage, he argues, is a species.
sentences.chinese: 卡汉认为，那个支系就是物种。

sentences.english: There were others Bo people live in north and northwest of Bozhou at Shong Dyn…
sentences.chinese: 此外，播州正北及西北宋代犹有其他人支系活动。

sentences.english: There were others Bo people live in north and northwest of Bozhou at Shong Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 此外，播州正北及西北宋代犹有其他人支系活动。

sentences.english: If it is between children and mother, fhe language is shifted to hers.
sentences.chinese: 若子女与母亲说话，应改用母亲支系的语言。

definition: (of watercourses) source and direction of flow/origin and development
to inhabit a region (esp. ethnic group)/to congregate
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China
